oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Modelling an industrial ethylene oxide reactor
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MOUDGALYA, KM
GOYAL, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ethene oxide reactor
epoxidation reactor
tubular reader
distributed parameter systems
dynamic modelling
method of lines
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An industrial catalytic tubular reactor used to make ethylene oxide is described by a system of nonlinear partial differential equations. The dimensionless model is integrated by the method of lines. Excellent agreement between the plant and the model predicted data has been obtained. Simulations show that increases in the temperature of the reactor are accompanied by higher rates of reaction, which is desirable, and increased production of CO(2), which is undesirable. This difficult to control industrial reactor case study can be used to test control theories. Copyright (C) 1998 IFAC.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: DYNAMICS & CONTROL OF PROCESS SYSTEMS 1998, VOLUMES 1 AND 2,651-656
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 5th IFAC Symposium on Dynamics and Control of Process Systems (DYCOPS 5),CORFU, GREECE,JUN 08-10, 1998
